message:
shows battery replace now
replaced 3 new batteries and the battery cable still same thing 
replaced the main board still same ?
is it touchpad related !!
very weird

Does it show X on battery, or percentage?
Post F7000 voltage with charger only, and charger + battery.

Check resistance to ground on SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.

Other board installed shows same issue 
shows battery 52% replace now
This sounds like a bunch of bad batteries....

I'm bit confused now...
Do you have two boards which report same issue with the same battery?
I doubt to be both boards bad; pretty sure battery issue.

Have even 3 board installed and replaced 3 batteries so far 
giving the same issue 
replace now .
when disconnecting the charger it die right away .
could the battery cable the connecting the battery with motherboard do this !!!

If you have 3 MLBs, don't you have the original batteries for them?
These ones give the same error?
Or you get error only with "new" (fake) batteries?

I have one original battery and 2 replacements one 
I get the error with all of them .
the main problem was non working keyboard 
the laptop was working fine with its original battery .
( turns on with battery only but non of the keys worked )
there was corrosion on the touchpad cable which prevented the keyboard to work . Cleaned the touchpad cable and keyboard 
works fine now .
connect everything back now not staying on without 
charger pluggged .
Could be all bad Batteries.
or Fu***** hunted MacBook .

Trackpad (SMBus 3) and battery (SMBus 5) are connected on different I2C bus.
So shouldn't give conflict.
Unfortunately, theory and practice not always correspond...

Solved 
needed OEM battery cable 
thank you 2informaticos
